items.standfirst: The FBI says a family member recognised the 22-year-old man from Utah from surveillance images released to the public.
items.content: The FBI says a family member recognised the 22-year-old man from Utah from surveillance images released to the public.

items.title: Utah Governor After Kirk Killing: 'Social Media Is A Cancer On Our Society Right Now'
items.standfirst: Utah Gov. Spencer Cox called on Americans to reject political violence and embrace unity following the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a university event in Orem, Utah. Cox confirmed that law enforcement has taken a suspect into custody in connection with the shooting, POLITICO…

Spencer Cox called on Americans to reject political violence and embrace unity following the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a university event in Orem, Utah. items.title: Questions linger about alleged shooter’s motivation for killing Charlie Kirk
items.standfirst: Suspect’s background and politics are being pored over in aftermath of killing of far-right influencerThough the suspect in the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk was revealed by authorities on Friday, questions surrounding his identity and motivations have exacerbated intense US political debates in the aftermath of the shooting.Authorities revealed Kirk’s suspected killer to be Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old man who grew up in Washington, Utah, along the state’s south-western border. Continue reading...
items.content: Suspect’s background and politics are being pored over in aftermath of killing of far-right influencerThough the suspect in the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk was revealed by authorities on Friday, questions surrounding his identity and motivations have exacerbated intense US political debates in the aftermath of the shooting.Authorities revealed Kirk’s suspected killer to be Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old man who grew up in Washington, Utah, along the state’s south-western border. Continue reading...

items.title: WATCH: Erika Kirk delivers first public remarks after fatal shooting of her husband Charlie Kirk
items.standfirst: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk's widow said on Friday her husband's "mission" would be more powerful than ever before in her first statement after his killing.
items.content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk's widow said on Friday her husband's "mission" would be more powerful than ever before in her first statement after his killing.

items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect held without bail
items.standfirst: The man accused of killing conservative commentator and activist Charlie Kirk is being held without bail in a Utah jail. Meanwhile, vigils and memorials across the country honored Kirk as his widow made her first public remarks since his death.
items.content: The man accused of killing conservative commentator and activist Charlie Kirk is being held without bail in a Utah jail. Meanwhile, vigils and memorials across the country honored Kirk as his widow made her first public remarks since his death.

items.title: Charlie Kirk's widow: 'You have no idea what you have just unleashed'
items.standfirst: Erika Kirk said Charlie Kirk's mission will continue, and thanked law enforcement and President Trump for supporting her family in the aftermath of her husband's death.
items.content: Erika Kirk said Charlie Kirk's mission will continue, and thanked law enforcement and President Trump for supporting her family in the aftermath of her husband's death. (Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)

items.title: Why reaction to Charlie Kirk's killing has many concerned about the country's future
items.standfirst: NPR's Scott Simon talks with political commentator Charlie Sykes about the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk and its effect on political discourse.
items.content: NPR's Scott Simon talks with political commentator Charlie Sykes about the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk and its effect on political discourse.

items.title: Who is the suspect arrested for Charlie Kirk's assassination?
items.standfirst: The family of the young Utah man accused of shooting Charlie Kirk told authorities he had recently become “more political” and recounted a dinner table conversation where they discussed whether the conservative activist was spreading hate. Tyler James Robinson, 22, of Washington, Utah, was arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm causing serious bodily harm, and obstruction of justice, all felonies, according to a probable cause statement filed in court and released Friday. A judge ordered that he be held without bail.
items.content: The family of the young Utah man accused of shooting Charlie Kirk told authorities he had recently become “more political” and recounted a dinner table conversation where they discussed whether the conservative activist was spreading hate. Tyler James Robinson, 22, of Washington, Utah, was arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm causing serious bodily harm, and obstruction of justice, all felonies, according to a probable cause statement filed in court and released Friday. A judge ordered that he be held without bail.

items.title: Charlie Kirk's widow says her cries 'will echo around the world'
items.standfirst: Erika Kirk, the widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, described him as a "perfect" husband and father, and said the "evildoers" who assassinated him have no idea what they have unleashed.
items.content: Erika Kirk, the widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, described him as a "perfect" husband and father, and said the "evildoers" who assassinated him have no idea what they have unleashed.

items.title: Charlie Kirk's suspected killer brought into custody after confessing to father
items.standfirst: Tyler Robinson is accused of shooting the right-wing activist while he was speaking at a university in Utah on Wednesday.
items.content: Tyler Robinson is accused of shooting the right-wing activist while he was speaking at a university in Utah on Wednesday.

items.title: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect Identified as 22-Year-Old Utah Man
items.standfirst: Authorities have named Tyler Robinson as a suspect in the murder of right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk, citing Discord messages as evidence of his alleged role.
items.content: Authorities have named Tyler Robinson as a suspect in the murder of right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk, citing Discord messages as evidence of his alleged role.

items.title: Charlie Kirk suspect arrested after tip-off from father
items.standfirst: US officials have confirmed the suspect in the killing of Charlie Kirk has been arrested and identified as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson.
items.content: US officials have confirmed the suspect in the killing of Charlie Kirk has been arrested and identified as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson.

ai_summary: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed at Utah Valley University.
Police arrested Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old man, as the suspect in the shooting.
The suspect is being held without bail in a Utah jail.
Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika Kirk, made her first public statement after the shooting.
Vigils and memorials were held across the country to honor Charlie Kirk.

clusters.title: James’s Tim Booth criticises Tommy Robinson for ‘cynical’ use of their song

items.title: James’s Tim Booth criticises Tommy Robinson for ‘cynical’ use of their song
items.standfirst: Sit Down was played at Unite the Kingdom rally in London and singer says song is ‘antithesis’ of far-right movementThe lead singer of the band James has criticised Tommy Robinson for the “cynical” use of the group’s hit song in a protest video.Tim Booth said he was “disgusted” that the alternative rock band’s single Sit Down had been played without their permission, as he believed the song was “the antithesis” of the far-right activist’s movement. Continue reading...
items.content: Sit Down was played at Unite the Kingdom rally in London and singer says song is ‘antithesis’ of far-right movementThe lead singer of the band James has criticised Tommy Robinson for the “cynical” use of the group’s hit song in a protest video.Tim Booth said he was “disgusted” that the alternative rock band’s single Sit Down had been played without their permission, as he believed the song was “the antithesis” of the far-right activist’s movement. Continue reading...

items.title: Police assaulted as far-right rally led by Tommy Robinson sparks clashes
items.standfirst: More than 110,000 people join Tommy Robinson-organised protest featuring racist conspiracy theories and hate speechMore than 110,000 people have taken part in a far-right street protest organised by the activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known as Tommy Robinson, in what is thought to be the largest nationalist event in decades.Marchers travelled to London by train and coach for a demonstration, which was billed as a “festival of free speech”, but by its conclusion had amplified racist conspiracy theories and anti-Muslim hate speech across Whitehall. Continue reading...
items.content: More than 110,000 people join Tommy Robinson-organised protest featuring racist conspiracy theories and hate speechMore than 110,000 people have taken part in a far-right street protest organised by the activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known as Tommy Robinson, in what is thought to be the largest nationalist event in decades.Marchers travelled to London by train and coach for a demonstration, which was billed as a “festival of free speech”, but by its conclusion had amplified racist conspiracy theories and anti-Muslim hate speech across Whitehall. Continue reading...

items.title: Thousands attend London march organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson
items.standfirst: Thousands of demonstrators packed London streets Saturday for a march organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson.
items.content: Thousands of demonstrators packed London streets Saturday for a march organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson.

items.title: Elon Musk calls for dissolution of parliament at far-right rally in London
items.standfirst: US-based tech boss was addressing the ‘unite the kingdom’ protest organised by Tommy Robinson via video link Elon Musk has called for a “dissolution of parliament” and a “change of government” in the UK while addressing a crowd attending a “unite the kingdom” rally in London, organised by the far-right activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known as Tommy Robinson.Musk, the owner of X, who dialled in via a video link and spoke to Robinson while thousands watched and listened, also railed against the “woke mind virus” and told the crowd that “violence is coming” and that “you either fight back or you die”. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: London protest organized by far-right activist exceeds 100,000 as clashes break out
items.standfirst: A London march organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson drew more than 100,000 people and became unruly on Saturday as a small group of his supporters clashed with police officers who were separating them from counterprotesters.
items.content: A London march organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson drew more than 100,000 people and became unruly on Saturday as a small group of his supporters clashed with police officers who were separating them from counterprotesters.

items.title: Dozens of officers injured as up to 150,000 join Tommy Robinson rally
items.standfirst: Some 25 arrests are made after "unacceptable violence" at demonstrations in central London, police say.
items.content: Some 25 arrests are made after "unacceptable violence" at demonstrations in central London, police say.

items.title: Bottles thrown at police as 100 officers clash with ‘unite the kingdom’ marchers – UK politics live as it happened
items.standfirst: Met police estimate 110,000 people attended rally, with smaller number of counter-protesters ‘penned in’More than a hundred people have gathered outside Russell Square before the ‘march against fascism’ counter-protest against the ‘unite the kingdom’ march, featuring far-right activist Tommy Robinson, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon. Both are being held in central London on Saturday.According to the PA news agency, people in Russell Square milled around with placards that said “refugees welcome” and “oppose Tommy Robinson”. Chants of “say it loud, say it clear, refugees are welcome here” started at about 11.20am, the news agency reports.The far right are a menace to the whole of society. Their first targets, asylum seekers and Muslims, are broadening to all migrants, black people and on to trade unionists, all religious minorities and anti-racists.This is going to be big, but we are also talking about movement to the right of Reform UK and we still don’t know where it is going. Continue reading...
items.content: Met police estimate 110,000 people attended rally, with smaller number of counter-protesters ‘penned in’More than a hundred people have gathered outside Russell Square before the ‘march against fascism’ counter-protest against the ‘unite the kingdom’ march, featuring far-right activist Tommy Robinson, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon. Both are being held in central London on Saturday.According to the PA news agency, people in Russell Square milled around with placards that said “refugees welcome” and “oppose Tommy Robinson”. Chants of “say it loud, say it clear, refugees are welcome here” started at about 11.20am, the news agency reports.The far right are a menace to the whole of society. Their first targets, asylum seekers and Muslims, are broadening to all migrants, black people and on to trade unionists, all religious minorities and anti-racists.This is going to be big, but we are also talking about movement to the right of Reform UK and we still don’t know where it is going. Continue reading...

items.title: Up to 150,000 people attend massive anti-immigration march in London, police say
items.standfirst: More than 100,000 anti-immigration protesters marched in London Saturday at a rally organised by far-right figure Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, popularly known as Tommy Robinson. Police made 25 arrests after some of the attendees clashed with law enforcement officers, leaving more than two dozen injured.

items.content: Tens of thousands of people are expected to descend on Britain’s capital on Saturday for the largest far-right rally in decades, organized by anti-immigration activist Tommy Robinson.

items.content: President Trump said that NATO's commitment to winning the war in Ukraine "has been far less than 100%."

Trump posted on his social media site that NATO’S commitment to winning the war…

items.title: Trump calls on all NATO countries to stop buying Russian oil, threatens 50% to 100% tariffs on China
Trump calls all NATO countries to stop buying Russian oil and slap tariffs on China
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Saturday urged all NATO countries to stop buying oil from Russia and impose their own tariffs of 50 to 100 percent on China until the end of the Ukraine war. NATO members Turkey, Hungary and Slovakia all continue to purchase oil from Russia.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday urged all NATO countries to stop buying oil from Russia and impose their own tariffs of 50 to 100 percent on China until the end of the Ukraine war. NATO members Turkey, Hungary and Slovakia all continue to purchase oil from Russia.

items.title: Trump urges NATO countries stop buying Russian oil before US sanctions

items.content: The US president says it is 'shocking' that members of the alliance continue to buy Russian oil.

items.standfirst: The war in Ukraine would end if all NATO countries stopped buying oil from Russia, Donald Trump has said.
items.content: The war in Ukraine would end if all NATO countries stopped buying oil from Russia, Donald Trump has said.

ai_summary: Donald Trump called on all NATO countries to stop buying Russian oil.
Trump believes this action would end the war in Ukraine.
He threatened tariffs of 50% to 100% on China for Russian oil purchases.
Some NATO members, like Turkey, Hungary, and Slovakia, still buy Russian oil.
Trump stated it is "shocking" that NATO members continue to buy Russian oil.

items.standfirst: The House of Representatives was dissolved by the country's president, following deadly anti-corruption protests.
items.content: The House of Representatives was dissolved by the country's president, following deadly anti-corruption protests.

items.standfirst: Following deadly protests across Nepal, the country has appointed former Chief Justice Sushila Karki as interim PM.
items.content: Following deadly protests across Nepal, the country has appointed former Chief Justice Sushila Karki as interim PM.

items.title: Nepal gets first female PM after week of deadly anti-corruption protests
items.standfirst: Nepal has appointed its first female prime minister, following a week of deadly protests.
items.content: Nepal has appointed its first female prime minister, following a week of deadly protests.

items.title: Nepal sets March elections after naming interim prime minister
items.standfirst: Nepal's former chief justice Sushila Karki was sworn in Friday as the country's prime minister to lead a six-month transition to elections, after deadly anti-corruption protests ousted the government. The previous prime minister quit Tuesday as parliament was set ablaze.
items.content: Nepal's former chief justice Sushila Karki was sworn in Friday as the country's prime minister to lead a six-month transition to elections, after deadly anti-corruption protests ousted the government. The previous prime minister quit Tuesday as parliament was set ablaze.

items.title: Nepal appoints its first female PM after historic week of deadly protests
items.standfirst: Former chief justice Sushila Karki, who was nominated by gen Z representatives, to lead interim governmentNepal has sworn in its first female prime minister after a historic week in which widespread youth protests forced the resigniation of her predecessor and the dissolving of parliament.Sushila Karki, the former chief justice of Nepal, took the oath of office late on Friday, after several tense days of negotiation. Karki will lead an interim government until fresh elections take place in March next year. Continue reading...
items.content: Former chief justice Sushila Karki, who was nominated by gen Z representatives, to lead interim governmentNepal has sworn in its first female prime minister after a historic week in which widespread youth protests forced the resigniation of her predecessor and the dissolving of parliament.Sushila Karki, the former chief justice of Nepal, took the oath of office late on Friday, after several tense days of negotiation. Karki will lead an interim government until fresh elections take place in March next year. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Nepal appointed Sushila Karki as interim prime minister after protests.
The protests were against corruption and led to the government's ousting.
Karki, the former Chief Justice, will lead until elections in March.
The House of Representatives was dissolved following the protests.
Nepal is set to hold elections in March after the appointment.

clusters.title: Rubio calls Russian drones over Poland 'unacceptable' but declines to say it was intentional
clusters.neutral_headline: NATO Bolsters Eastern Flank After Russian Drone Incursion

items.title: Rubio calls Russian drones over Poland 'unacceptable' but declines to say it was intentional
items.standfirst: Nato announces plans to beef up defense as Poland rejects Trump’s suggestion drones were sent by mistakeThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, on Saturday said the incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace this week was unacceptable but that it remained unclear whether Russia had deliberately sent the drones into Polish territory. Nato announced plans to beef up the defense of Europe’s eastern flank on Friday, after Poland shot down the drones that had violated its airspace, the first known shots fired by a member of the western alliance during Russia’s war in Ukraine.“We think it’s an unacceptable and unfortunate and dangerous development,” Rubio told reporters before departing on a trip to Israel and Britain. Continue reading...
items.content: Nato announces plans to beef up defense as Poland rejects Trump’s suggestion drones were sent by mistakeThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, on Saturday said the incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace this week was unacceptable but that it remained unclear whether Russia had deliberately sent the drones into Polish territory. Nato announced plans to beef up the defense of Europe’s eastern flank on Friday, after Poland shot down the drones that had violated its airspace, the first known shots fired by a member of the western alliance during Russia’s war in Ukraine.“We think it’s an unacceptable and unfortunate and dangerous development,” Rubio told reporters before departing on a trip to Israel and Britain. Continue reading...

items.title: NATO bulks up defences on eastern flank after Russian drone incursion
items.standfirst: NATO said Friday it's bulking up its defensive posture on its eastern flank bordering Belarus, Russia and Ukraine with new equipment to deter potential Russian aggression following an incursion by Russian drones into Polish territory. The alliance's supreme commander in Europe said a new operation, dubbed Eastern Sentry, will add equipment from France, Denmark, Germany and the UK to its existing air and ground-based defenses.
items.content: NATO said Friday it's bulking up its defensive posture on its eastern flank bordering Belarus, Russia and Ukraine with new equipment to deter potential Russian aggression following an incursion by Russian drones into Polish territory. The alliance's supreme commander in Europe said a new operation, dubbed Eastern Sentry, will add equipment from France, Denmark, Germany and the UK to its existing air and ground-based defenses.

items.title: New Nato mission to bolster eastern flank after Russia drone incursion
items.standfirst: France, Denmark and Germany will send jets to Poland after Russian drones flew into its airspace.
items.content: France, Denmark and Germany will send jets to Poland after Russian drones flew into its airspace.

items.title: UK joins NATO operation to bolster Europe's eastern flank
items.standfirst: NATO is to bolster Europe's eastern flank, including the use of UK military resources, after Russia's "reckless and unacceptable" violation of Polish airspace.
items.content: NATO is to bolster Europe's eastern flank, including the use of UK military resources, after Russia's "reckless and unacceptable" violation of Polish airspace.

ai_summary: Marco Rubio called the Russian drone incursion into Poland "unacceptable."
NATO is increasing defenses on its eastern flank bordering Belarus, Russia, and Ukraine.
France, Denmark, and Germany will send jets to Poland.
The UK is joining the NATO operation to bolster Europe's eastern flank.
Poland shot down the drones that violated its airspace.

items.title: Ukraine hits one of Russia's largest oil refining complexes with explosive drone attack
items.standfirst: Kyiv's military intelligence agency on Saturday confirmed that a Ukrainian drone struck one of Russia's largest oil refineries roughly 1,400 kilometres from the Ukraine border. Russian official Radiy Khabirov said that the attack had caused minor damage to the refinery.
items.content: Kyiv's military intelligence agency on Saturday confirmed that a Ukrainian drone struck one of Russia's largest oil refineries roughly 1,400 kilometres from the Ukraine border. Russian official Radiy Khabirov said that the attack had caused minor damage to the refinery.

items.title: Ukraine drone starts fire at one of Russia’s largest oil plants
items.standfirst: Head of Bashkortostan region reports second drone shot down and minor damage to Bashneft’s Ufa refineryA Ukrainian drone has crashed into one of Russia’s largest oil-refining complexes, sparking a fire and causing minor damage, a Russian official has said.The complex, which belongs to Russian oil company Bashneft, lies on the outskirts of the central Russian city of Ufa about 870 miles (1,400km) from the frontline in Ukraine. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A Ukrainian drone struck a major Russian oil refinery.
The refinery is located approximately 1,400 kilometers from the Ukrainian border.
The attack caused a fire and minor damage to the refinery.
The refinery is one of Russia's largest oil refining complexes.
The attack was confirmed by Kyiv's military intelligence agency.

The May 28, 2021, loan estimate was issued by a credit union…

The May 28, 2021, loan estimate was issued by a credit union…

items.title: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims
items.standfirst: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims WASHINGTON — Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook referred to a condominium she purchased in June 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, a characterization that could undermine claims by the Trump…
items.content: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims WASHINGTON — Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook referred to a condominium she purchased in June 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, a characterization that could undermine claims by the Trump…

items.title: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims
items.standfirst: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.
items.content: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)

items.title: Fed governor Lisa Cook declared key property as ‘vacation home’, files show
items.standfirst: Document appears to undermine claim from Donald Trump allies that Cook committed mortgage fraudA loan estimate for an Atlanta home purchased by Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor accused of mortgage fraud by the Trump administration, shows that Cook had declared the property as a “vacation home”, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.The document, dated 28 May 2021, was issued to Cook by her credit union in the weeks before she completed the purchase and shows that she had told the lender that the Atlanta property would not be her primary residence. The document appears to counter other documentation that Cook’s critics have cited in support of their claims that she committed mortgage fraud by reporting two different homes as her primary residence, two independent real-estate experts said. Continue reading...
items.content: Document appears to undermine claim from Donald Trump allies that Cook committed mortgage fraudA loan estimate for an Atlanta home purchased by Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor accused of mortgage fraud by the Trump administration, shows that Cook had declared the property as a “vacation home”, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.The document, dated 28 May 2021, was issued to Cook by her credit union in the weeks before she completed the purchase and shows that she had told the lender that the Atlanta property would not be her primary residence. The document appears to counter other documentation that Cook’s critics have cited in support of their claims that she committed mortgage fraud by reporting two different homes as her primary residence, two independent real-estate experts said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook declared a condo as a "vacation home."
This declaration could undermine claims of mortgage fraud.
The loan estimate was issued by a credit union in 2021.
The document appears to counter claims of mortgage fraud.
The Trump administration had previously accused Cook of mortgage fraud.

items.content: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel ramps up its offensive there and urges Palestinians to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday.

items.content: A barrage of airstrikes has killed at least 32 people in Gaza City as Israel continued intensifying its offensive there, medical staff have said.

items.title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens amid expanding offensive in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City amid Israel's expanding offensive. While Gazans are urged to evacuate, many say they don't know where to go as there are no safe zones in the enclave.
items.content: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City amid Israel's expanding offensive. While Gazans are urged to evacuate, many say they don't know where to go as there are no safe zones in the enclave.

items.title: IDF cautions Netanyahu over Gaza invasion as airstrikes kill dozens
items.standfirst: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel escalated its military campaign and urged residents to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday. Meanwhile, the IDF issued their strongest warning yet to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, cautioning that a ground assault on Gaza City could result in the deaths of Israeli hostages, FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.
items.content: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel escalated its military campaign and urged residents to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday. Meanwhile, the IDF issued their strongest warning yet to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, cautioning that a ground assault on Gaza City could result in the deaths of Israeli hostages, FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.

ai_summary: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 32 people in Gaza City.
Israel is intensifying its offensive in Gaza.
Medical staff reported the casualties from the airstrikes.
Residents are urged to evacuate, but many have nowhere to go.
The IDF cautioned Netanyahu about a ground assault on Gaza City.

items.title: Oscar-winning Palestinian says home in West Bank raided by Israeli soldiers
items.standfirst: Director Basel Adra reports his property was stormed while he was at a hospital with relatives injured in settler attacksPalestinian Oscar-winning director Basel Adra has said that Israeli soldiers have conducted a raid at his West Bank home, searching for him and going through his wife’s phone.Israeli settlers attacked his village on Saturday, injuring two of his brothers and one cousin, Adra told the Associated Press. He accompanied them to the hospital. While there, he said that he heard from family in the village that nine Israeli soldiers had stormed his home. Continue reading...

items.title: Poland Scrambles Jets Amid Renewed Drone Threat in Nearby Ukraine Territory
items.standfirst: Poland remains on high alert after Russia violated its airspace earlier this week when it fired 19 drones at Ukraine.
items.content: Poland remains on high alert after Russia violated its airspace earlier this week when it fired 19 drones at Ukraine.

items.title: Poland deploys planes due to threat of drone strikes in nearby Ukraine
items.standfirst: ‘Preventive operations’ included putting air defence systems on high alert and followed serious Russian incursion earlier in the weekPolish and allied aircraft have been deployed in a “preventive” operation in Poland’s airspace because of a threat of drone strikes in neighbouring areas of Ukraine, and the airport in the eastern Polish city of Lublin was closed, authorities have said.The alert on Saturday lasted about two hours. On Wednesday multiple Russian drones had crossed into Poland, prompting Nato to send fighter jets to shoot them down, underlining long-held concerns about the expansion of Russia’s more than three-year war in Ukraine. Continue reading...
items.content: ‘Preventive operations’ included putting air defence systems on high alert and followed serious Russian incursion earlier in the weekPolish and allied aircraft have been deployed in a “preventive” operation in Poland’s airspace because of a threat of drone strikes in neighbouring areas of Ukraine, and the airport in the eastern Polish city of Lublin was closed, authorities have said.The alert on Saturday lasted about two hours. On Wednesday multiple Russian drones had crossed into Poland, prompting Nato to send fighter jets to shoot them down, underlining long-held concerns about the expansion of Russia’s more than three-year war in Ukraine. clusters.title: Israel hostages forum says Qatar air strikes show Netanyahu is an obstacle to ending Gaza war
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel-Qatar air strikes: Netanyahu an obstacle to peace

items.title: Israel hostages forum says Qatar air strikes show Netanyahu is an obstacle to ending Gaza war
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Saturday claimed that killing Hamas's leadership in Qatar, which Israel tried and failed to do in an unprecedented air strike on the US ally on Tuesday, would remove the main obstacle to ending the war in Gaza. But Israel's own Hostages and Missing Families Forum said the attack was yet another example of Netanyahu sabotaging prospective peace deals.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Saturday claimed that killing Hamas's leadership in Qatar, which Israel tried and failed to do in an unprecedented air strike on the US ally on Tuesday, would remove the main obstacle to ending the war in Gaza. But Israel's own Hostages and Missing Families Forum said the attack was yet another example of Netanyahu sabotaging prospective peace deals.

items.title: WATCH: Rubio discusses U.S. priorities with Gaza war as he departs for trip to Israel

items.content: Despite tensions between Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, notably over Israel’s attack on Hamas leaders in Qatar, Rubio will arrive in Israel on Sunday for a two-day visit.

clusters.title: U.N. assembly votes for two-state solution to Israel-Palestinian conflict
clusters.neutral_headline: UN backs two-state solution for Israel-Palestine conflict

items.title: U.N. assembly votes for two-state solution to Israel-Palestinian conflict
items.standfirst: The United States, Israel's closest ally, reiterated its opposition to the New York Declaration and the General Assembly resolution endorsing implementation of a two-state solution.
items.content: The United States, Israel's closest ally, reiterated its opposition to the New York Declaration and the General Assembly resolution endorsing implementation of a two-state solution.

items.title: UN assembly votes to back two-state solution to Israel-Palestinian conflict
items.standfirst: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a nonbinding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. The vote was 142-10 with 12 abstentions.
items.content: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a nonbinding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. The vote was 142-10 with 12 abstentions.

items.title: UN assembly votes to back two-state solution for Israel and Palestine
items.standfirst: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a non-binding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. FRANCE 24 correspondent Jessica Le Masurier brings us more.
items.content: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a non-binding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. FRANCE 24 correspondent Jessica Le Masurier brings us more.

ai_summary: The UN General Assembly voted to support a two-state solution.
The resolution urged Israel to commit to a Palestinian state.
The vote endorsed the "New York Declaration" plan.
The vote was overwhelmingly in favor, with 142 votes for.
The United States reiterated its opposition to the resolution.

clusters.title: Pakistan security forces kill 35 militants in raids on Pakistani Taliban
clusters.neutral_headline: Pakistan security forces kill militants in raids

items.title: Pakistan security forces kill 35 militants in raids on Pakistani Taliban
items.standfirst: Twelve soldiers also killed during raids on two TTP hideouts on border with AfghanistanFierce clashes broke out in Pakistan near the border with Afghanistan when Pakistani security forces raided two hideouts of the Pakistani Taliban, killing 12 soldiers and 35 militants, the military said on Saturday.Twenty-two militants were killed in the first raid in Bajaur, a district in north-western Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. Thirteen more were killed in a separate operation in South Waziristan district. Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve soldiers also killed during raids on two TTP hideouts on border with AfghanistanFierce clashes broke out in Pakistan near the border with Afghanistan when Pakistani security forces raided two hideouts of the Pakistani Taliban, killing 12 soldiers and 35 militants, the military said on Saturday.Twenty-two militants were killed in the first raid in Bajaur, a district in north-western Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. Thirteen more were killed in a separate operation in South Waziristan district. Continue reading...

items.content: Military confirms deadly operations in Bajaur and South Waziristan amid rising attacks by the Pakistan Taliban.
